p: The demographic, clinical and virological characteristics at hospital admission of the 80 acute hepatitis B patients included in the study are reported in Table 1. All patients were HBsAg and anti-HBc IgM positive. They were enrolled in two periods 16 years apart: 50 cases in 1978–79 and 30 cases in 1994–95. The two groups were similar for demography, distribution of HBV markers and clinical features.
